segments.text: Look at that, the woman's just standing there polishing her plate oblivious to everything.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Water's gushing out of the sink like a waterfall right onto the cabinet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I didn't expect the faucet to be running full blast with no one watching it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The floor's turning into a lake, and her shoe's soaked through.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Now, turning my head, I spot the kids up to no good with the cookie jar.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is stretched out on that rickety stool, grabbing cookies like it's a heist.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: His sister's right there, hand out, grinning I bet, though I can't see her face.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's kind of funny how they're conspiring while mom's right behind them.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The open cabinets make it look like a little adventure scene.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Outside the window, everything's calm with the bushes and path so neat.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder how long until someone slips or the stool gives way.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This kitchen's about to turn into chaos, but for now, it's entertaining.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The dishes stacked on the counter add to the busy feel.
segments.speaker: PAR
